title: Beacon client crashed with OOM during init-sync
body:
Beacon client (af5cc31565629f3e766b11caf7d8a7560d6c8901) showed the following behavior (repeatedly, every time):
- Started init sync normally (with existing DB)
- After some minutes it dropped most of the peers
- After ~2min some peers were reconnected
- Then there was a sudden surge in memory usage and it crashed, presumably due to my docker memory limit of 8G

Not as far as I know of, this is a new issue it looks like.
Assigning to @farazdagi as owner of new initial sync work.

Synced several times using the following command (8GiB memory limit, no swap):

```bash
docker run -it -v $HOME/prysm:/data -p 4000:4000 --memory 8g --memory-swap 8g \                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
  gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:latest \
  --datadir=/data --enable-byte-mempool --enable-state-field-trie \
  --new-state-mgmt --enable-ssz-cache
```

On average, `docker stats` reported ~4GiB of memory used, but had to set limit to 8GiB as there're currently spikes (those are w/i that limit as I've been running container without the restart flag - to catch any OOMs).

@farazdagi I would recommend re-opening this.

I have been using 0.3.10 to run `initial-sync` for the past 4 days. The process consistently crashes after ~1.5-2 hours, simply reporting `Killed` in the output.

Upon further investigation, and measuring memory usage using `top`, the process running prysm proceeds to consume all available physical memory, then consumes all available swap, and when swap hits 0, the process fails.

Here are screenshots, charting the process:

`16:25:09` Run the script to start the process, `beacon-chain-v0`, which takes **10% of available memory**:

![Screenshot from 2020-04-10 19-35-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2212651/78997531-60d8fa00-7b64-11ea-969c-97f725a50cbe.png)

`16:29:05`, process has **30% of available memory**:

`18:13:18`, process has **77.8% of available memory**, with `202.7Mb` of swap left:

![Screenshot from 2020-04-10 19-36-50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2212651/78997975-4ce1c800-7b65-11ea-9cc0-d2e87819a452.png)

`18:13:24`, process rises to **78.5% of available memory**, with `60.9Mb` of swap left:

![Screenshot from 2020-04-10 20-49-26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2212651/79001948-10b26580-7b6d-11ea-8ca6-cda5f92a3ff1.png)

`18:13:38`, process peaks at **79.6% of available memory**, taking all remaining swap, and fails, reporting `Killed` (`top` hasn't updated yet):

![Screenshot from 2020-04-10 19-37-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2212651/79001579-53c00900-7b6c-11ea-979c-4c33e1c0300c.png)

![Screenshot from 2020-04-10 20-54-26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2212651/79002226-a1894100-7b6d-11ea-97a7-952acd452c2f.png)
